docs.lead_paragraph: The World Health Organization estimates that snakebites kill between 20,000 and 94,000 people a year, though some experts consider this estimate too low.

headline.seo: Public Health Experts Calls for a New Emphasis on Snakebite
headline.main: Snakebite: Experts Seek New Emphasis on Quiet Killer
headline.print_headline: Snakebite: Experts Seek New Emphasis on Quiet Killer

docs.abstract: Two papers arguing for a new emphasis on combating snakebite deaths worldwide are presented at the annual meeting of the American Society of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene; the World Health Organization estimates that snakebites kill between 20,000 and 94,000 people a year, though some experts consider this estimate too low.
docs.snippet: The World Health Organization estimates that snakebites kill between 20,000 and 94,000 people a year, though some experts consider this estimate too low.

docs.lead_paragraph: Turns out mom was right: Keep your hands off the raw cookie dough.
docs.abstract: A new study that investigated the cause of a large outbreak of E. coli in 2009 pointed the blame at raw cookie dough.
docs.snippet: A new study that investigated the cause of a large outbreak of E. coli in 2009 pointed the blame at raw cookie dough.
